data.title: Moderna stock ticks higher as first set of COVID-19 vaccine data is ready for analysis
data.text: Moderna Inc. MRNA shares ticked higher in the extended session Wednesday after the biotech company said the first batch of data from its late-stage test of an experimental COVID-19 vaccine was ready for analysis. Moderna shares rose 1% after hours, following an 8.4% rise to close the regular session at $82.44.

data.title: Moderna says company has enough cases to provide analysis on its Covid-19 vaccine trial
data.text: CNBC's Meg Tirrell says Moderna announced it has enough cases to determine if its vaccine works. She joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss.

data.title: Moderna Has Completed Case Accrual for First Planned Interim Analysis of its mRNA Vaccine Against COVID-19 (mRNA-1273)
data.text: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Moderna has completed case accrual for first planned interim analysis of its mRNA vaccine against COVID-19 (mRNA-1273).

data.title: Why Moderna Stock Vaulted Higher Today
data.text: Hint: It had nothing to do with the biotech's coronavirus vaccine candidate.

data.title: Moderna's Cancer Vaccine Scores in a Clinical Trial
data.text: Early-stage clinical trial results suggest adding mRNA-4157 to Keytruda can improve response rates.

data.title: Moderna Pops After Fauci Predicts Its Vaccine Will Be As Effective As Pfizer's
data.text: Moderna popped Wednesday after Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, predicted its coronavirus vaccine would be as effective as Pfizer's. The post Moderna Pops After Fauci Predicts Its Vaccine Will Be As Effective As Pfizer's appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Pfizer's Covid-19 Success Bodes Very Well For Moderna
data.text: While Pfizer‘s surprisingly strong initial Covid-19 vaccine efficacy readout likely marks the beginning of the end of the Covid-19 pandemic, it probably doesn't mean too much for Pfizer stock, given the limited potential profits and challenges with distribution. data.title: Vaccine Hopes Rise as Pharma Giants Inch Closer Toward Success
data.text: Stocks of Eli Lilly and Company (LLY), Pfizer, Inc. (PFE) and Moderna, Inc. (MRNA) have been in focus since the coronavirus outbreak as they have been the frontrunners in the vaccine race.
